svcproc.title: AD-TECH RADIATOR SERVICE PROCEDURES FOR NAVISTAR INTERNATIONAL TRUCKS
svcproc.para: The radiator tanks are molded glass-filled nylon and are secured to the core header by Side-lock latching strips.

step1.para: Assemble header support frame around core and position five L clamps along the tank and header support frame as shown in Figure 2. If so desired the header support frame can be constructed as shown in Figure 10 or purchased from Johnson Manufacturing Company. See "special service tools and equipment" section.
Hand tighten L clamps evenly until the Side-lock latching strips become loose enough to be removed by hand or with the aid of a small screwdriver. Excessive torque is not required.

note.para: To prevent header distortion it is very important that the header be completely supported on all four sides (See Figure 2). For cores smaller than 28.56" one end of the header support frame must be positioned up to the core support under the header. The other end of the header is supported by sliding the adjustable header end support (See Figure 10) up to the core support under the header.

step1.para: The radiator is equipped with Side-lock latching strips ( Figure 3) and retainers ( Figure 7 and Figure 8). To remove the retainer, pry outward on the bottom to disengage the retainer teeth from the header slot, then pull the retainer upward as shown in Figure 8. After the retainers are removed, the Side-lock latching strips are removed by tapping the strip lo the left with a screw driver and hammer until the tabs of the strip can easily be pulled out of the header slots. (6 strips and 4 retainers per header). Discard the old strips and retainers
Loosen and remove header clamps and header support frame.
Lift tank from the core header.
Remove the O-ring seal from the header. Discard the old O-ring seal.
Inspect the sealing surface of the radiator core header to be sure it is clean and free of foreign material or damage.
Dip the new O-ring in fresh glycol and place the gasket in the header groove.
Position the tank to the header using caret not to scratch the tank sealing surfaces. Be sure the top and bottom of the tank is positioned properly.

Clamp the tank in position on the header with five (5) L clamps and header support frame as shown in Figure 2. Tighten the header clamps to compress the O-ring gasket until the Side-lock latching strips can be inserted by hand.

note.para: There are four different length Side lock latching strips, see Figure 4.

step1.para: For a 26.5" header each side requires assembly with one 16 tab strip and one 21 tab strip. The 3 tab strips are for assembly at header ends. For a 29.2" header a 20 tab strip is required instead of a 16 tab strip.

Insert Side-lock latching strips, making sure all tabs are positioned into header slots. Tap strips to the right using a screw driver and hammer as shown in Figure 5. This tapping locks the new strip Into place. When fully engaged there will be an opening in the left hand edge of the header slot, see Figure 6.
Remove the header clamps and header support from the header core.

Lock the Side-lock latching strips in place with retainers. Install (1) retainer between the 21-tab strip and the 16-tab (or 20-tab) strip (2 per header), and (1) retainer at each 3-tab strip (2 per header) as shown in Figure 7. When installing the retainers, hook the top of the retainer over the header flange, then pull down as shown in Figure 8.
The teeth of the retainer must be fully engaged into the header slot at the opening to the left of the latching strip tab as shown in Figure 9.

note.para: At the center of the header, (1) retainer is used to lock (2) latching strips.

svcprocinfo.para: The draincock and vent fitting are in the plastic tank and can be replaced without disassembling the radiator.

step1.para: Turn the stern counter/clockwise to unscrew the stem. When the stem is unscrewed to the end of the threads, pull the stem from the radiator tank and body.
Remove the retainer body from the radiator tank by squeezing the sides together with a pair of needlenose pliers. Then, pull the retainer body from the tank.
Remove retainer body from draincock or vent fitting stem.
Snap retainer body into radiator tank.
Snap draincock or vent fitting into retainer body.
Tighten draincock or vent fitting by turning clockwise. Tighten to 2.0 - 7.7 N•m (18 - 25 in - lb.).

svcproc.title: RADIATOR CORE REPAIR
svcproc.para: The Ad Tech radiator core is of copper-brass construction and can be repaired by using the usual good radiator shop repair procedures for this type of radiator core. Note, however, that heat must be kept from the header/gasket/tank area, unless the plastic tank is first removed from the radiator core.

caution.para: Do not attempt to dean an Ad Tech radiator core using caustic cleaning solutions unless the plastic tanks are first removed. Immersing the plastic tanks in a caustic cleaning solution can damage the tanks and O-ring gaskets.
